executable.title: Enhance Edges Using Diffusion (TubeTK)
executable.description: Performs edge enhancing anisotropic diffusion: smooths strongly in the direction parallel to an edge, while smoothing normal to the edge is inversely proportional to the gradient. Implemented as described in Mendrik et al., Noise reduction in computed tomography scans using 3-D anisotropic diffusion with continuous switch, IEEE Transactions on Medical Imaging, 28(10), pp. 1585-1594, 2009.
executable.contributor: Danielle F. Pace, Andinet Enquobahrie, Hua Yang, Stephen R. Aylward (Kitware)
executable.acknowledgements: This work is part of the TubeTK project at Kitware.

double.name: scaleParameter
double.label: Scale
double.description: Scale at which first derivatives are calculated when determining the structure tensor and gradient magnitude. If set too low, filter will be overly sensitive to noise. If set too high, small structures will not be well preserved.

double.name: eedContrastParameter
double.label: EED Contrast
double.description: Contrast of edges, as opposed to noise. If set too low, noise will not be filtered. If set too high, plate-like structures will not be preserved.

integer.name: numberOfIterations
integer.label: Number of Iterations
integer.description: Number of iterations used in optimization.
